text: Hugh Ramapolo Masekela (4 April 1939 â€“ 23 January 2018) was a South African trumpeter, flugelhornist, cornetist, composer and singer. He has been described as the "father of South African jazz." Masekela was known for his jazz compositions and for writing well-known anti-apartheid songs such as "Soweto Blues" and "Bring Him Back Home". Masekela died in Johannesburg on 23 January 2018 from prostate cancer, aged 78."Hugh Masekela, South African jazz trumpeter, dies", BBC News, 23 January 2018 accessdate 23 January 2018 ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2018 deaths Category:20th-century composers Category:21st-century composers Category:Bandleaders Category:South African anti-apartheid activists Category:Jazz musicians Category:Jazz singers Category:South African musicians Category:South African singers Category:Trumpeters
title: Hugh Masekela
